name: Emotional Disaster College Collaboration Project (WIP/Unfinished)
description:
This was a college collaboration project with my friend, Josie. She is responsible for all of the artwork in the game while I am responsible for the coding. The game is designed to work with a rotary phone as a controller, but also works with the number keys on a keyboard. 

All of the controls should be listed within the game on screen, but just in case they are as follows:

1-8 = Selecting various options/ Choosing and continuing the dialogue

9 = Selecting the highlighted option

0 = Quitting to the main menu/ Restarting the game

The game is unfinished and will not be continued, all sounds are from freesounds.org, there is supposed to be an end screen but it doesn't always show up, the button resetting the game will still work regardless and there is a prompt in the menu saying that. 

This is what happens when at least half of the brains making creative decisions are not the best in social situations, and then decide to make a game about social situations.

The selection screens are intended to remove whatever emotion is selected, it is intended to be misleading but I understand if it isn't the clearest thing in the world.

(This is being marked as educational because of the pop up in the airport about phobias, this is not an educational game)
